23:01 <+sburjan> vmassol: reminder about the pull requests :)  
23:02 <+sburjan> or any other committer :P  
23:08 <abusenius> has quit  
23:24 <polx> Hello XWikiers, has someone properly understood programming rights?  
23:25 <polx> I have the very same code, on half my resources, that display $xwiki.getXWiki() (so... fail there) and half which happily return the object.  
23:26 <polx> This makes all our tracker fail.  
23:26 <@sdumitriu> polx: Programming rights is the last solution  
23:26 <@sdumitriu> You shouldn't require PR in your code  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> My suggestion is to move the code that requires privileged access someplace else  
23:27 <polx> I don't want to... I just want to call xwiki.getXWiki().Param  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> Where?  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> I mean, where is that code?  
23:27 <vmassol> has quit  
23:27 <polx> that used to be in our xwikivars.vm and in our analytics.vm.  
23:28 <@sdumitriu> It means that it only works if the page that you are viewing has PR  
23:29 <polx> That's my understanding as well but why is it so and was it not so when in 1.5?  
23:30 <@sdumitriu> It was always like this  
23:30 <@sdumitriu> Actually, what changed is that PR are definitely not available after the document content  
23:30 <polx> would these correspond to pages whose content was last  saved by an admin the others by a non-admin?  
23:30 <@sdumitriu> This means panels, bottom tabs, footer  
23:31 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
23:31 <polx> That's not in the panel, that's before.  
23:31 <polx> isn't there a "programming permissions" when in xwikivars.vm then dropping?  
23:31 <@sdumitriu> "A page has PR" means "the page was last saved by a user that has programming rights allowed to him globally"  
23:33 <polx> or that the page was saved with saveWithProgrammingRights?  
23:34 <polx> I'm trying to find a code to analyze which page has programming rights... is this the one ? $xwiki.hasAccessLevel("programming", $request.user, $request.doc)  
23:35 <polx> is there an SQL way to check?  
23:39 <@sdumitriu> No, saveWithProgrammingRights doesn't set PR for that document  
23:40 <@sdumitriu> It lets the current user save the document even if he doesn't have the right to do so  
23:40 <@sdumitriu> For example, it lets guests add a "password reset token" to a user's document, through a script located in a page that does have PR  
23:40 <polx> Right right.  
23:41 <polx> So, how can I analyze?  
23:50 <polx> @sdumitriu, how can I analyze?  
23:53 <polx> (how can I write a code to read if a page has programming rights)  
23:59 <@sdumitriu> Back  
23:59 <@sdumitriu> It's simple, $doc.hasProgrammingRights()
